intro: Psychotria cornifer, commonly known as the red-stemmed psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a distinctive calyx. Psychotria cornifer is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth.
